title: "dplyr key"
author: "Jeff Leek"
date: "July 7, 2015"
output: html_document
---

1. You could do this by hand or: 
```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(downloader)
download("ftp://ftp.1000genomes.ebi.ac.uk/vol1/ftp/technical/working/20130606_sample_info/20130606_sample_info.xlsx",destfile="1000genomes.xlsx")
```

3. 
```{r}
library(readxl)
library(janitor)
# Have to skip one row because there is an extra header
kg = read_excel("1000genomes.xlsx",sheet=4,skip=1)
# subset to just low coverage
kg = kg[,1:7]

# make column names easier to handle
kg = kg %>% clean_names()

```

4. 
```{r}
kg %>% group_by(platform_4) %>% summarize(sum(total_sequence_5))
```

5. 
```{r}
kg %>% group_by(center_3) %>% summarize(sum(total_sequence_5))
```

6. 

```{r}
kg %>% filter(passed_qc_7==1)
```


7. 

```{r}
kg %>% filter(passed_qc_7==1) %>%
  filter(center_3=="BCM")
```

8. 

```{r}
kg %>% filter(passed_qc_7==1) %>%
  filter(center_3=="BCM") %>%
  group_by(population) %>%
  summarize(meancov = mean(aligned_non_duplicated_coverage),nsamp=n())
```
